metadata.synopsis: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees

0.speaker: Rozzak
0.text: One of 'em was prayin' when I slit its throat. Who do devils even pray to?
0.context: NodeContext: just finished slaughtering civilians, guards and refugees hiding in a druid grove - pondering a specific killing. Amused.

1.speaker: Rozzak
1.text: Enjoy killin' yer own kind, do ya?
1.context: NodeContext: Rushing into battle - the 'horns an' a tail' refers not to monsters, but to tiefling refugees. A warcry. Alternative line "enjoying killin' yer own kind" is a wry comment; the player is also a tiefling participating in a raid on his/her own kind
